filmography.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
filmography.role_description: The mysterious, reclusive neighbor who becomes a silent guardian to the Finch children; Duvall's haunting film debut.
filmography.plot: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children against prejudice.

filmography.title: Captain Newman, M.D.
filmography.role_description: A tormented Air Force officer suffering from severe PTSD in a military psychiatric ward.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a captain in the Medical Corps runs the psychiatric ward of an Army Air Corps hospital.

filmography.title: The Chase
filmography.role_description: A cowardly, henpecked bank employee who fears the return of an escaped convict.
filmography.plot: The escape of Bubber Reeves from prison affects the inhabitants of a small Southern town.

filmography.title: True Grit
filmography.role_description: The leader of the outlaw gang pursued by Rooster Cogburn, culminating in a famous showdown.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.

filmography.title: The Rain People
filmography.role_description: A highway patrolman who becomes involved with a distraught housewife on a cross-country road trip.
filmography.plot: A pregnant housewife flees her Long Island home and picks up a brain-damaged hitchhiker on her journey.

filmography.title: M*A*S*H
filmography.role_description: A hypocritical, disciplined, and incompetent surgeon who becomes the target of Hawkeye and Trapper's pranks.
filmography.plot: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of war.

filmography.title: THX 1138
filmography.role_description: A man living in a dystopian future who rebels against the suppressed, drug-controlled society.
filmography.plot: In the twenty-fifth century, a time when people have designations instead of names, a man struggles to escape his totalitarian society.

filmography.title: The Godfather
filmography.role_description: The Corleone family's adopted son and consigliere, serving as the calm, rational voice amidst the violence.
filmography.plot: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

filmography.title: Joe Kidd
filmography.role_description: A wealthy landowner who hires a tracker to hunt down a Mexican revolutionary, sparking a conflict.
filmography.plot: An ex-bounty hunter helps a wealthy landowner track down a Mexican revolutionary leader.

filmography.title: The Godfather Part II
filmography.role_description: Reprising his role as the loyal consigliere who navigates the treacherous expansion of the Corleone empire.
filmography.plot: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

filmography.title: The Killer Elite
filmography.role_description: A mercenary who betrays his partner (James Caan), setting off a violent revenge mission.
filmography.plot: A private security agent is betrayed by his partner and left for dead, but recovers to protect a client and seek revenge.

filmography.title: Network
filmography.role_description: A ruthless television executive who exploits a deranged news anchor for ratings.
filmography.plot: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit.

filmography.title: The Eagle Has Landed
filmography.role_description: A German officer who devises a daring plot to kidnap Winston Churchill during World War II.
filmography.plot: A German plot to kidnap Winston Churchill unfolds at the height of World War II.

filmography.title: The Seven-Per-Cent Solution
filmography.role_description: A loyal and concerned Dr. Watson who takes Sherlock Holmes to Sigmund Freud to cure his addiction.
filmography.plot: To treat his friend's cocaine addiction, Dr. Watson lures Sherlock Holmes to Vienna, where he meets Sigmund Freud.

filmography.title: Apocalypse Now
filmography.role_description: A surfing-obsessed, napalm-loving cavalry commander who delivers the iconic line, 'I love the smell of napalm in the morning.'
filmography.plot: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; BAFTA & Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: The Great Santini
filmography.role_description: A warrior without a war, a domineering Marine pilot who runs his family with military precision and harsh discipline.
filmography.plot: A Marine pilot's strict disciplinary parenting style causes conflict with his family as they move to a new town.

filmography.title: True Confessions
filmography.role_description: A cynical homicide detective who clashes with his brother, a priest, during a murder investigation.
filmography.plot: Two brothers, one a priest and the other a cop, find their relationship tested by a murder case involving the church.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Tender Mercies
filmography.role_description: A washed-up country singer who finds redemption and a second chance at life with a young widow and her son.
filmography.plot: A broken-down, middle-aged country singer gets a new wife, reaches out to his long-lost daughter, and tries to put his troubled life back together.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: The Natural
filmography.role_description: A cynical sports journalist who tries to uncover the mysterious past of baseball phenomenon Roy Hobbs.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged unknown comes out of nowhere to become a legendary baseball player with almost supernatural talent.

filmography.title: Colors
filmography.role_description: A veteran cop on the verge of retirement who tries to teach his hotheaded rookie partner how to handle gang violence.
filmography.plot: An experienced cop and his rookie partner patrol the gang-ridden streets of East Los Angeles, trying to keep the peace.

filmography.title: Lonesome Dove
filmography.role_description: An aging, charismatic Texas Ranger who embarks on one last cattle drive; widely considered his definitive role.
filmography.plot: Two former Texas Rangers renew their spirit of adventure as they and several other residents of a small Texas town join a cattle drive to the Montana Territory.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Miniseries); Emmy Nomination

filmography.title: Days of Thunder
filmography.role_description: A veteran NASCAR crew chief who comes out of retirement to mentor a talented but reckless young driver.
filmography.plot: A young hot-shot stock car driver gets his chance to compete at the top level.

filmography.title: Stalin
filmography.role_description: A chilling portrayal of the Soviet dictator, capturing his rise to power and his brutal reign.
filmography.plot: A biopic of Joseph Stalin, detailing his rise from a revolutionary to the absolute ruler of the Soviet Union.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Miniseries/TV Movie)

filmography.title: Falling Down
filmography.role_description: A retiring police detective who tracks a man's violent rampage across Los Angeles on his last day on the job.
filmography.plot: An unemployed defense worker frustrated with society goes on a violent rampage across Los Angeles.

filmography.title: The Apostle
filmography.role_description: A charismatic Pentecostal preacher who flees the law and starts a new church in the bayou seeking redemption.
filmography.plot: After assaulting his wife's lover, a preacher flees Texas and changes his identity, starting a new church in Louisiana.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Independent Spirit Award: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: A Civil Action
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, brilliant defense attorney who outmaneuvers a personal injury lawyer in a high-stakes environmental case.
filmography.plot: A tenacious lawyer takes on a case involving a major company responsible for contaminating a town's water supply.

filmography.title: Open Range
filmography.role_description: An aging cattleman who fights back against a corrupt land baron to protect his free-grazing herd.
filmography.plot: A former gunslinger is forced to take up arms again when he and his cattle crew are threatened by a corrupt lawman.

filmography.title: Secondhand Lions
filmography.role_description: One of two eccentric great-uncles who recount their adventurous youth to their young nephew over a summer.
filmography.plot: A shy young boy is sent to spend the summer with his two eccentric, wealthy uncles in Texas.

filmography.title: The Judge
filmography.role_description: A stern, estranged father and judge accused of murder, who must rely on his lawyer son for defense.
filmography.plot: Big-city lawyer Hank Palmer returns to his childhood home where his estranged father, the town's judge, is suspected of murder.
